intro: Kochia platyphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to central Asia. It is characterized by its upright, bushy growth habit and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in late summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Kochia platyphylla is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes used as a ornamental plant.
